shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Freshmen add to Riverside-Old Forge rivalry
shorts.title_distilled: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Freshmen add to Riverside-Old Forge rivalry.
shorts.description: Riverside and Old Forge already have an intense rivalry in all sports. But things should be interesting in girls basketball for the next three years. That is because each team has a talented freshman helping to lead them this season. Faith Pavalonis is at Riverside and Lana Clements is at Old Forge. As the second half of the Lackawanna League campaign gets under way Friday, Pavalonis leads Division II in scoring with 15.1 points, which ranks 10th overall in the league. She also ranks among the top foul shooters at 75.9 percent (66 for 87). “It feels good,” Pavalonis said […]
shorts.content: Riverside and Old Forge already have an intense rivalry in all sports. But things should be interesting in girls basketball for the next three years. That is because each team has a talented freshman helping to lead them this season. Faith Pavalonis is at Riverside and Lana Clements is at Old Forge. As the second half of the Lackawanna League campaign gets under way Friday, Pavalonis leads Division II in scoring with 15.1 points, which ranks 10th overall in the league. She also ranks among the top foul shooters at 75.9 percent (66 for 87). “It feels good,” Pavalonis said […]
shorts.content_distilled: Riverside and Old Forge already have an intense rivalry in all sports.

shorts.title: Clipboard, January 23, 2026
shorts.description: Lackawanna County Seed sowing workshop: Winter seed sowing workshop, Jan. 31, 1 p.m., Albright Library. Penn State master gardeners will explain the seed-starting technique and participants will create a mini-greenhouse, plant provided seeds and take home mini-greenhouse. Material fee is $10. Registration is required; call 570-348-3000. Moscow Women meet: Moscow Women’s Club will hold a meeting and celebrate Valentine’s Day with sweet treats and beverages Feb. 3 at noon in the social hall of the Daleville Methodist Church, 423 Dorantown Road at Route 435, Covington Twp. In addition, some senior chair exercises will be demonstrated. Attendees are invited to wear […]

shorts.title: The Dime Bank supports United Neighborhood Centers
shorts.title_distilled: Dime Bank supports United Neighborhood Centers.
shorts.description: The Dime Bank donated $20,000 to United Neighborhood Centers of Northeastern Pennsylvania through the state Department of Community and Economic Development’s Educational Improvement Tax Credit program. UNC used the funding to operate Project Hope Day Camp — a safe, supportive environment where children from low-income families in Scranton can learn, grow and thrive during the summer months. The camp focuses on building essential life skills such as emotional regulation, mindfulness, physical activity and social connection. From left: Jude McDonough, UNC board chair; Lisa Durkin, UNC president and CEO; Robert F. Karoscik, Dime Bank vice president banking relationship officer; and Kellyn […]
shorts.content: The Dime Bank donated $20,000 to United Neighborhood Centers of Northeastern Pennsylvania through the state Department of Community and Economic Development’s Educational Improvement Tax Credit program. UNC used the funding to operate Project Hope Day Camp — a safe, supportive environment where children from low-income families in Scranton can learn, grow and thrive during the summer months. The camp focuses on building essential life skills such as emotional regulation, mindfulness, physical activity and social connection. From left: Jude McDonough, UNC board chair; Lisa Durkin, UNC president and CEO; Robert F. Karoscik, Dime Bank vice president banking relationship officer; and Kellyn […]
shorts.content_distilled: Dime Bank donated $20,000 to United Neighborhood Centers of Northeastern Pennsylvania through the state Department of Community and Economic Development’s Educational Improvement Tax Credit program.

shorts.title: HS ROUNDUP: Battaglia scores 1,000th point in Scranton’s win
shorts.title_distilled: HS ROUNDUP: Battaglia scores 1,000th point in Scranton’s win.
shorts.description: Tony Battaglia had 31 points, including the 1,000th of his career, to lead Scranton to a 65-51 win over North Pocono on Thursday night in a Lackawanna League Division I boys basketball game at Scranton. Battaglia reached the milestone in the second quarter, hitting one of his seven 3-pointers of the game. Jayden Mayers added 12 points, while Justin Mayers and Max DePietro each had seven points for the Knights (6-9, 3-5). Cole West had 22 points for the Trojans (4-12, 1-7). Scranton Prep 77, Delaware Valley 58: At Delaware Valley, Packy Doherty had 29 points, including six 3-pointers, to […]
shorts.content: Tony Battaglia had 31 points, including the 1,000th of his career, to lead Scranton to a 65-51 win over North Pocono on Thursday night in a Lackawanna League Division I boys basketball game at Scranton. Jayden Mayers added 12 points, while Justin Mayers and Max DePietro each had seven points for the Knights (6-9, 3-5). Cole West had 22 points for the Trojans (4-12, 1-7). shorts.title: BOYS BASKETBALL: Antoniacci, Rose power Riverside past Holy Cross
shorts.title_distilled: BOYS BASKETBALL: Antoniacci, Rose power Riverside past Holy Cross.
shorts.description: DUNMORE – Nico Antoniacci and Brayden Rose were relentless and put on a show to earn an emphatic victory. Riverside’s one-two punch attacked the basket, had a couple of dunks, swished some long-range shots, and displayed an abundance of athleticism and skill. Antoniacci, the much-coveted collegiate prospect in only his sophomore season, scored 43 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, and four steals. Rose, a talented junior, had 27 points, eight rebounds, five assists, and two blocked shots. Their efforts fueled the second-ranked Vikings in an overpowering 95-81 win over No. 9 Holy Cross on Thursday night in an entertaining boys […]
shorts.content: DUNMORE – Nico Antoniacci and Brayden Rose were relentless and put on a show to earn an emphatic victory. Riverside’s one-two punch attacked the basket, had a couple of dunks, swished some long-range shots, and displayed an abundance of athleticism and skill. Antoniacci, the much-coveted collegiate prospect in only his sophomore season, scored 43 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, and four steals. Rose, a talented junior, had 27 points, eight rebounds, five assists, and two blocked shots. Their efforts fueled the second-ranked Vikings in an overpowering 95-81 win over No. 9 Holy Cross on Thursday night in an entertaining boys […]
